header_summary:
The release of Penlock, an open-source paper calculator for cryptographic security, marks a significant leap in digital asset management. It simplifies the mechanical splitting of a 12-word seed phrase into a 2-of-3 backup format, employing robust cryptography methods and offering an innovative on-paper error correction algorithm. This tool, highlighted for its user-friendly approach and enhanced security features, is detailed further at [Penlock's website](https://v1.penlock.io/en/).

Discussions within the Bitcoin community, as shared by Edil Guimarães de Medeiros and others, highlight ongoing efforts to innovate without altering the Bitcoin Core. Strategies include utilizing existing node interfaces for problem-solving and acknowledging Bitcoin's resilience to network reorganizations. These conversations underscore the community's commitment to flexible, robust solutions and invite further contributions, as seen in the exchange found at [this source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CANJiN3LnCFJxJpGxScLTqT2JF4iQNsX3hipiNiBK_OLMkkXb1g@mail.gmail.com/T/#m654e5e23f8ad4ee28cdd3b01874a0112cadb9d270).

A draft Bitcoin Improvement Proposal suggests standardizing on-chain identity publication, aiming for enhanced security through canonical CBOR payloads and Poseidon-based domain separation. This initiative seeks community feedback on interoperability and security, highlighting the collaborative nature of Bitcoin's evolution. More information is available through the proposal link at [GitHub](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/2038).

The development of raw₿it, a visual, node-based editor for constructing Bitcoin transactions, represents a breakthrough in educational tools for cryptocurrency. By enabling users to visually build transactions and understand the underlying Python code, raw₿it enhances learning and experimentation. This tool, emphasizing privacy and accessibility, is detailed with a demonstration at [raw₿it's website](https://rawbit.io) and [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wGZ5H535jwQ).

recent_posts.title: Announcing Penlock v1: Paper-Based Secret Splitting for BIP39 Seed Phrases
recent_posts.summary:
- Penlock is a novel cryptographic tool for managing digital assets with a 2-of-3 backup format.
- It introduces a paper-based error correction algorithm and simplifies BIP39 seed phrase generation.
- The public release includes enhancements like a generic backup strategy template and invites users to reverse-engineer its algorithm.

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Standardization of On-Chain Identity Publication
recent_posts.summary:

recent_posts.title: Gossip Observer: New project to monitor the Lightning P2P network
recent_posts.summary:
- An analysis shows potential for managing large data flows in networks using compact structures.
- Strategic update timing and a 64kb set for 8,000 entries make high-volume handling feasible.
- Careful planning could enable real-time, large-scale data exchange in robust systems.

recent_posts.title: MergeSync: Parallel UTXO-set construction in assumevalid trust model
recent_posts.summary:
- SwiftSync proposes managing UTXO sets without an 80MB hints file, increasing memory use.
- It limits signature validation by not allowing assumevalid feature disablement.
- Despite drawbacks, it offers data management efficiency, especially in order-independent operations.

recent_posts.title: Raw₿it — the visual raw transaction builder & script debugger
recent_posts.summary:
- The raw₿it node-based editor enables intuitive Bitcoin transaction building and learning.
- Features include multi-tab, undo/redo, dark mode, local save/load, and testnet broadcasting.
- Open-source and privacy-focused, raw₿it offers hands-on cryptocurrency transaction lessons.

- The email outlines a new method for managing objectionable Bitcoin blockchain content without harming its integrity.

active_posts.title: Stats on compact block reconstructions
active_posts.summary:
- The study analyzes compact block reconstructions in Bitcoin, focusing on transactions and node configurations.
- Adjustments in node settings, notably `mempoolfullrbf=1`, improved compact block reconstruction efficiency.
- Analysis suggests optimizing block reconstructions could benefit from changes in transaction handling and node setups.

active_posts.title: Proposal: OP_STARK_VERIFY - Native STARK Proof Verification in Bitcoin Script
active_posts.summary:
- The proposed `OP_STARK_VERIFY` opcode aims to integrate STARK proof verifications directly into Bitcoin.
- Challenges include credible neutrality, large proof sizes, and consensus risks of a specific proof system.
- Alternatives explored include `OP_CAT`-based verifiers, with `OP_STARK_VERIFY` offering a simpler, efficient solution.

active_posts.title: Taxonomy of Transaction Fees in Smart Contracts
active_posts.summary:
- The email explores fee mechanisms in Bitcoin transactions, impacting mempool design and scaling.
- It contrasts endogenous and exogenous fee structures within smart contracts and the impact on transaction complexity.
- Discussion includes CPFP strategies, package RBF, and their implications for Bitcoin's Lightning Network and smart contracts.

today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Greg Sanders proposed "Ephemeral Anchors" to solve Bitcoin's package limit issue.
- His solution enhances smart contract composability and seeks feedback on implementation complexity.
- It introduces Ephemeral Anchors to navigate mempool limitations, raising MEV and SIGHASH_GROUP concerns.

today_in_history_posts.title: Mitigating Channel Jamming with Reputation Credentials: a Protocol Sketch
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Dave highlights credential tampering risks in classic payment paths by intermediary nodes.
- Nodes may jam others, avoiding attacks on payments passing through to preserve fees.
- Protection mechanisms can reduce channel jamming to only accidental instances.
